pull.title: ci: use Ubuntu Jammy for Windows cross-compilation CI
pull.body: This means we'll compile using [GCC 10.3.x](https://packages.ubuntu.com/jammy/g++-mingw-w64) and [mingw-w64 8.0.0](https://packages.ubuntu.com/jammy/mingw-w64) which better matches our Guix release environment.

events.body: Concept ACK, Approach NACK. Hirsute is EOL, please use Bullseye or Jammy.
For reference, I suspect mingw was bumped in commit 711ce2e5333bd6717f9b114abe7ec1d1994afbc4

rename.from: ci: use Ubuntu Hirsute for Windows cross-compilation CI
rename.to: ci: use Ubuntu Jammy for Windows cross-compilation CI

events.body:
ACK 8416818965381cef30301d61df6153f570326f20

(I dislike the inconsistency of using `ubuntu:focal`/`ubuntu:jammy` in `.cirrus.yml` and `ubuntu:20.04`/`ubuntu:22.04` in `ci/test/*.sh`, but that's probably for some other PR)

Concept ACK. Besides the compilers better matching it's good to have a CI run with 22.04.

> I'm confused, isn't Ubuntu 22.04 planned for April this year?

It's in beta IIRC. Ubuntu releases tend to be usable already a few months before their official release.

There are only two major changes planned for Jammy: clang-14 and Gnome, see https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/jammy-jellyfish-release-schedule/23906 . Neither of which should matter for this pull request.

> For reference, I suspect mingw was bumped in commit https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/711ce2e5333bd6717f9b114abe7ec1d1994afbc4

The version of mingw-w64 used in Guix didn't change with 711ce2e5333bd6717f9b114abe7ec1d1994afbc4. Previously (22.0) we used [8.0.0 from the version-1.3.0 Guix branch](https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/guix.git/tree/gnu/packages/mingw.scm?h=version-1.3.0), and the version in [Guix master at present is still 8.0.0](https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/guix.git/tree/gnu/packages/mingw.scm).

verification.payload:
tree 91daada964f6d73c2777e844ab3a38be95ff5b6d
parent 66636ca438cb65fb18bcaa4540856cef0cee2029
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1644407616 +0000
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1645197545 +0000

ci: use Ubuntu Jammy for Windows CI

This means we'll compile using GCC 10.3.x and mingw-w64 8.0.0 which
better matches our Guix release environment.

events.message:
ci: use Ubuntu Jammy for Windows CI

This means we'll compile using GCC 10.3.x and mingw-w64 8.0.0 which
better matches our Guix release environment.

events.body: I've rebased this. It's now passing locally when I run the CI.
ACK a1515cdd9683942d733ff509b785cb3ca73c7a30, I have reviewed the code and it looks OK, I agree it can be merged.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -7,7 +7,7 @@
 export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
 export CONTAINER_NAME=ci_win64
-export DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:20.04  # Check that Focal can cross-compile to win64
+export DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:22.04  # Check that Jammy can cross-compile to win64
comments.body: I'm confused, isn't Ubuntu 22.04 planned for April this year?

comments.body: Yes, it is. And it is going to be a LTS release.
